item.title: Command (Solved)
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:5, topic:541356”]This will depend on how you handle command arguments, assuming you have a rune-source like base do something [size=24pt]like [/size]the following,

switch (keyword.toLower()) { case "setrights": PlayerHandler.getPlayer(args[0]).setRights(Integer.parseInt(args[1])); break; // ... }[/quote]

What I posted is what is called pseudo-code, you can’t copy paste it into your source and expect it to work. I showed you the logic.

As for a getPlayer function you could do something like the following,

[code=java]Player getPlayer(String name) {
for (Player player : players) {
if (player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase(name)) {
return player;
}
}

return null;
}[/code]

A null check would be nice, to prevent a NullPointerException when somebody who isn’t logged ins name is typed. To extend this for logged out players, load their data into an arbitary Player object, set the rights, save it and destroy it - or just replace their rights directly from their save file.

[hr]

This is all you’re getting.

Read full topic

		I have no idea for this.
		c.playerRights?
